intro: Lonicera × misera, commonly known as the American honeysuckle, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern North America. It features opposite, ovate leaves that are usually dark green and have a slightly hairy texture. The plant produces fragrant, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its berries are red or orange and are an important food source for birds and small mammals. Lonicera × misera is often found in moist woodlands and along stream banks, where it thrives in partial to full shade.
